data.title: Famous Birthdays on December 22
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays for the 22nd of December. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals were born on December 22.
data.text:
Birthdays 1 - 200 of 230

Diocletian

Roman Emperor (284-305) who defeated the Sarmatians and Carpi [born between 242 and 245], born in Salona, Dalmatia, Roman Empire

Roger II

Count of Sicily (1105-30) and later King of Sicily (1130-54), born in Mileto, Calabria

Emperor Antoku of Japan, born in Kyoto, Kyoto Prefecture, Japan (d. 1185)

Luca della Robbia, Italian sculptor (Madonna of Rose Garden), born in Florence (d. 1482)

Sultan Cem, third son of Sultan Mehmed II and pretender to the Ottoman throne, born in Rumelia, Ottoman Empire (d. 1495)

Mary of Guise [Mary of Lorraine], French Queen consort of Scots (1538-42) and Regent of Scotland for daughter Mary Queen of Scots (1554-60), born in Bar-le-Duc, France (d. 1560)

Kuroda Yoshitaka, Japanese daimyō, born in Himeji, Hyōgo Prefecture, Japan (d. 1604)

Cesare Cremonini, Italian professor of natural philosophy, born in Cento, Papal States (now Italy) (d. 1631)

Ernst Casimir I, count of Nassau-Dietz and Stadtholder of Friesland, Groningen, and Drenthe, born in Dillenburg, Germany (d. 1632)

Tomas Micieres, Spanish composer and chapel master, born in Villaescusa de Ecla, Spain (d. 1662)

Jean Racine

French dramatist (Phèdre, Athalie), born in La Ferté-Milon, Picardy

Johann J Dillenius [Dillen], German botanist (Historia Muscorum), born in Darmstadt, Landgraviate of Hesse-Darmstadt, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1747)

Meidingnu Pamheiba, King of Manipur, born in Manipur (d. 1751)

Hermann Samuel Reimarus, German philosopher and writer, born in Hamburg, Germany (d. 1768)

James Oglethorpe, British soldier, politician, philanthropist, and founder of the US colony of Georgia, born in Godalming, Surrey, England (d. 1758)

Egbert de Vrij Temminck, Amsterdam regent, born in Amsterdam (d. 1785)

Jean-Étienne Liotard, Swiss-French painter, art connoisseur, and dealer (Madame d'Epinay), born in Geneva, Switzerland (d. 1789)

Carl Friedrich Abel, German composer, born in Köthen, Anhalt-Köthen, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1787)

William Ellery, US attorney and signer of the Declaration of Independence (Rhode Island), born in Newport, Rhode Island (d. 1820)

Charles Frederick, Margrave, Elector and later Grand Duke of Baden, born in Baden-Württemberg, Germany (d. 1811)

Johann Friedrich Pfaff, German mathematician, born in Stuttgart, Germany (d. 1825)

John Crome (Old Crome), English landscape artist, born in Norwich, England (d. 1821)

Alexander Gordon Laing, Scottish explorer (1st European to reach Timbuktu), born in Edinburgh, Scotland (d. 1826)

Thomas Ainsworth, English founder of Nijverdal & industrialist (Twentse textile), born in Lancashire, England (d. 1841)

Joseph King Fenno Mansfield, American Major General (Union Army), born in New Haven, Connecticut (d. 1862)

John Obadiah Westwood, British entomologist, born in Sheffield, United Kingdom (d. 1893)

Johann Sebastian Welhaven, Norwegian poet, born in Bergen, Norway (d. 1873)

Johanne Luise Heiberg, Danish actress (Romeo & Juliet), born in Copenhagen Denmark (d. 1890)

Johann Jakob Bachofen, Swiss antiquarian & jurist, born in Basel, Switzerland (d. 1887)

1815 Lucien Petipa, French ballet dancer, born in Marseille, France (d. 1898)

Franz Abt, German composer and choir conductor, born in Eilenburg, Prussian Saxony (d. 1885)

1819 Pierre Ossian Bonnet, French mathematician, born in Montpellier, France (d. 1892)

Giovanni Bottesini, Italian Romantic composer, conductor and a double bass virtuoso, born in Crema, Kingdom of Lombardy–Venetia (d. 1889)

James Scott Negley, American politician and Major General (Union Army), born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (d. 1901)

Justin M'Carthy, Irish politician and novelist (Miss Misanthrope), born in Cork, Ireland (d. 1912)

Mark Rutherford [Hale White], English writer, born in Bedford, England (d. 1913)

1831 Robert Ogden Tyler, Bvt Major General (Union Army), born in Hunter, New York (d. 1874)

Edward Hatch, American Brevet Major General (Union Army), born in Bangor, Maine (d. 1889)

Izydor Lotto, Polish violinist and composer, born in Warsaw, Poland (d. 1927)

Andreas Hallén, Swedish composer, born in Gothenburg, Sweden (d. 1925)

Constantin Fahlberg, Russian chemist who discovered Saccharin (artificial sweetener), born in Tambov, Russia (d. 1910) [1]

Teresa Carreño, Venezuelan classical pianist, soprano, composer, and conductor, born in Caracas, Venezuela (d. 1917)

1853 Yevgraf Fyodorov, Russian mathematician, born in Orensburg, Russia (d. 1919)

Frank Kellogg

American politician and diplomat (US Secretary of State, 1925-29), tried to outlaw war (Kellogg–Briand Pact: Nobel Peace Prize, 1929), born in Potsdam, New York

Giacomo Puccini

Italian opera composer (La bohème; Tosca; Madame Butterfly), born in Lucca, Grand Duchy of Tuscany

Austin Norman Palmer, American penmanship innovator, born in Fort Jackson, New York (d. 1927)

Erich Schaeder, German theologist (Theocentric Theology), born in Clausthal, Germany (d. 1936)

Connie Mack

American Baseball Hall of Fame catcher, manager and owner (World Series 1910, 11, 13, 29, 30; most managerial wins, losses and games managed in MLB history; Philadelphia A's), born in East Brookfield, Massachusetts

Jean-Baptiste Marchand, French military officer and explorer in Africa, born in Thoissey, France (d. 1934)

Mieczyslaw Surzynski, Polish organ virtuoso and composer (1904 Organ Concerto), born in Środa, Poland (d. 1924)

František Xaver Šalda, Czechoslovakian literary critic, born in Liberec, Czech Republic (d. 1937)

1867 Joseph Maria Olbrich, Austrian architect (Wiener Sezession), born in Opava, Czech Republic (d. 1908)

1867 Wilhelm Groener, German soldier and politician, born in Ludwigsburg, Germany (d. 1939)

Dmitri Egorov, Russian-Soviet mathematician, born in Moscow, Russia (d. 1931)

1869 Edwin Arlington Robinson, American poet (Richard Corey), born in Head Tide, Maine (d. 1935)

Camille Guérin, French veterinarian and bacteriologist, born in Poitiers, France (d. 1961)

Franz Schmidt, Austrian composer and musician, born in Bratislava, Slovakia (d. 1939)

Antoine Mariotte, French composer (Paysage maritime), born in Avignon (d. 1944)

1875 Johannes "Jan" Musch, Dutch actor (Dead Water), born in Amsterdam, Netherlands (d. 1960)

Filippo Tommaso Marinetti, Italian-French prose writer, novelist, poet, and dramatist (Futurism e Futurista), born in Alexandria, Egypt (d. 1944)

Stephen Timoshenko [Stepan Tymoshenko], Ukrainian-American mechanical engineer (elasticity; strength of materials), and pedagogue, born in Shpotovka, Russian Empire (d. 1972)

Stanislas Bizot, French draughts champion (1925), born in Nice, France (d. 1950)

Enver Pasa, Turkish politician, born in Istanbul, Turkey (d. 1922)

Arthur James Cook, British trade union leader (coal miners), born in Wookey, Somerset (d. 1931)

1883 Edgard Varèse, French-American composer (Ionisation; Poème électronique), born in Burgundy, France (d. 1965)

(Joseph) Deems Taylor, American music critic (New York World), composer (Through The Looking Glass; Peter Ibbetson), and promoter of classical music (Fantasia), born in New York City (d. 1966)

Srinivasa Ramanujan, Indian mathematician (number theory), born in Erode, British India (d. 1920)

J. Arthur Rank, English industrialist, born in Kingston upon Hull, United Kingdom (d. 1972)

Mikha`il Na'imah, Lebanese playwright, born in Baskinta, Lebanon (d. 1988)

1889 Minor Watson, American actor (Woman of the Year, Viva Cisco Kid), born in Marianna, Arkansas (d. 1965)

Harry Pollitt, General Secretary of the Communist Party of Great Britain, born in Droylsden, United Kingdom (d. 1960)

1890 Mark Tobey, American abstract painter (Broadway Norm), born in Centerville, Wisconsin (d. 1976)

Mihail Andricu, Romanian pianist, composer, violinist, and music professor (Bucharest Conservatory, 1926-59), born in Bucharest, Romania (d. 1974)

Nikolay Semyonovich Tikhonov, Russian poet and writer, born in St Petersburg, Russia (d. 1979)

Lionel Charles Robbins, British economist, born in Middlesex, England (d. 1984)

1898 Vladimir Aleksandrovich Fock, Soviet physicist, born in Saint Petersburg, Russia (d. 1974)

Gustaf Gründgens, German actor and director (M, Faust, A Glass of Water), born in Düsseldorf, Germany (d. 1963)

Alan Bush, English composer pianist and teacher, born in London (d. 1995)

Andre Kostelanetz, Russian-American conductor (Lincoln Portrait), born in St Petersburg, Russia (d. 1980)

Joe Adonis, Italian American crime-syndicate boss in NY & NJ, born in Montemarano, Italy (d. 1971)

1902 Philippe Leclerc de Hauteclocque, French general and WWII hero known as the "Liberator of Paris", born in Belloy-Saint-Léonard, France (d. 1947)

Barbara Moore, Russian-born British engineer (walked across US in 86 days in 1960), born in Russia (d. 1977)

Haldan Keffer Hartline

American biophysicist (Nobel 1967), born in Bloomsburg, Pennsylvania

1903 Marc Lavry [Levin], Latvian-Israeli composer (Emek; Independence Symphony; Song of Songs], and conductor, born in Riga, Latvia (d. 1967) [1]

Louis-Eugene-Felix Neel, French physicist (Nobel 1970), born in Lyon, France (d. 2000)

Kenneth Rexroth, American poet and translator & critical essayist (Birds in the Bush), born in South Bend, Indiana (d. 1982)

1905 Pierre Brasseur [Espinasse], French actor (Eyes Without a Face, Children of Paradise), born in Paris, France (d. 1972)

Tommy Flowers

English engineer (Colossus), born in Poplar, London

Peggy Ashcroft [Dame Edith Margaret Emily Ashcroft], British actress (Dear Brutus, Happy Days), born in Croydon, Surrey, England (d. 1991)

1907 Yoshio Hasegawa, Japanese composer, born in Tokyo, Japan (d. 1981)

Marius Duintjer, Dutch architect (Kolenkit), born in Veendam, Netherlands (d. 1983)

1908 Max Bill, Swiss architect and artist (Ruban Sans Fin), born in Winterthur, Switzerland (d. 1994)

Alan Carney [David Boughal], American actor (Zombies on Broadway, Take it from Me), born in Brooklyn, New York (d. 1973)

1909 Patricia Hayes, British actress (A Fish Called Wanda), born in Wandsworth, London, England (d. 1998)

Jimmy Boucher, Irish cricket all-rounder (28 first-class matches for Ireland; secretary Irish Cricket Union 1954-73), born in Dublin, Ireland (d. 1995)

1910 Richard Ainley, British actor (I Dood It, As You Like It, Above Suspicion), born in Middlesex, England (d. 1967)

Grote Reber, American radio astronomer (1st parabolic radio telescope), born in Wheaton, Illinois (d. 2002)

Claudia A. "Lady Bird" Taylor Johnson, American first lady (1963-1969), born in Karnack, Texas (d. 2007)

1912 Henry Armstrong, American boxer (world featherweight, lightweight, welterweight [19 x title defences] champion), born in Columbus, Mississippi (d. 1988)

Anthony Barber Doncaster, English bookseller, born in Sheffield, England (d. 1995)

Emil Sitka, American actor (Three Stooges shorts), born in Johnstown, Pennsylvania (d. 1998)

Barbara Billingsley, American actress (Leave it to Beaver), born in Los Angeles, California (d. 2010)

Andrew Fielding Huxley, English physiologist (Nobel 1963), born in London, England (d. 2012)

1917 Gene Rayburn [Jeljenić], American radio performer and TV game show host (Match Game), born in Christopher, Illinois (d. 1999)

1917 Piet De Somer, Belgian physician and biologist (U of Leuven), born in Belgium (d. 1985)

Frankie Darro [Frank Johnson], American actor (Radio Ranch, Wild Boys of the Road, Valley of Wanted Men), born in Chicago, Illinois (d. 1976)

1918 William Kennedy, American baseball player, born in Alexandria, Virginia (d. 1995)

Lillian "Lil" Green, American blues singer and songwriter ("Romance In The Dark"), born in Mississippi (d. 1954) [some sources cite year of birth as 1901, and some 1910]

Harold "Hawkshaw" Hawkins, American country singer (Ozark Jubilee; "Lonesome 7-7203"), born in Huntington, West Virginia (d. 1963)

1921 Robert Frank Kurka, American composer ("The Good Soldier Schweik"), born in Cicero, Illinois (d. 1957)

Calder Willingham, American novelist and scriptwriter, born in Atlanta, Georgia (d. 1995)

1922 Jack Brooks, American politician, born in Crowley, Louisiana (d. 2012)

1922 Jim Wright, American Democratic politician and Speaker of the House (1987-89), born in Forth Worth, Texas (d. 2015)

Heinz Bernhard [Löwenstein], German-born British actor and director (Oliver!, Fiddler on the Roof), born in Nuremberg, Germany (d. 1994)

1923 Joseph Muhler, American biochemist and dentist (developed Crest - 1st fluoride toothpaste), born in Fort Wayne, Indiana (d. 1996) [1]

Francesco "Frank" Corsaro, American opera director (The Night of the Iguana, Play of the Week), born in New York City (d. 2017)

Lewis Glucksman, American financier, born in Manhattan, New York (d. 2006)

Lee Salk, Russian-American child psychologist and author, born in New York, New York (d. 1992)

Peggy Castle, American actress (Lily Merrill-Lawman), born in Appalachia, Virginia (d. 1973)

Piero Angela, Italian science journalist and television host (Quark), born in Turin, Italy (d. 2022)

Dee Rowe, American college basketball coach (UConn Huskies men's team 1969-76; 103–78 [.569]), born in Worcester, Massachusetts (d. 2021)

1929 Leonard "Red" Balaban, American jazz tuba and sousaphone player, born in Chicago, Illinois (d. 2013) [1]

1929 Wazir Mohammad, Pakistan cricket batsman (20 Tests, 2 x 100; eldest of Pakistan's 4 Mohammad brothers), born in Junagadh, India

Bill Jenkins, American engine builder and drag racer (Motorsports Hall of Fame of America), born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania (d. 2012)

1930 Larry Stevenson [Richard], American skateboard innovator (kicktail), born in Santa Monica, California (d. 2012)

1930 Per Bredesen, Norwegian soccer forward (18 caps; Ørn Horten FK, Lazio, Udinese, AC Milan, Bari, Messina), born in Horten, Norway (d. 2022)

Phil Woosnam, Welsh soccer striker (Wales 17 caps; Leyton Orient, West Ham United, Aston Villa) and manager (USA 1968), born in Powys, Wales (d. 2013)

David Pearson

American auto racer (NASCAR Cup Series C'ship 1966, 68, 69; NASCAR Rookie of the Year 1960; Daytona 500 1976), born in Spartanburg, South Carolina

Anatoly Sass, Russian rower (Olympic gold USSR double sculls 1968), born in Moscow, Russia (d. 2023)

1935 John L. Finley, United States Navy aviator, born in Winchester, Massachusetts (d. 2006)

Hector Elizondo, American actor (American Gigolo, Young Doctors in Love), born in New York City

1936 James Burke, British science historian and broadcaster (Connections), born in Derry, Northern Ireland

1936 Wojciech Frykowski, Polish actor, born in Łódź, Poland (d. 1969)

Lucien Bouchard, French Canadian lawyer and politician, born in Saint-Cœur-de-Marie, Quebec

1938 Matty Alou, Dominican baseball outfielder (NL batting champion 1966; MLB All-Star 1968-69; Pittsburgh Pirates), born in Haina, Dominican Republic (d. 2011)

James Gurley, American rock lead guitarist (Big Brother and the Holding Company - "Piece Of My Heart"), born in Detroit, Michigan (d. 2009)

1939 Valentin Afonin, Russian soccer defender (42 caps; SKA Rostov-on-Don, CSKA Moscow), born in Vladimir, Russia (d. 2021)

Jim McLaughlin, Irish soccer striker (12 caps Northern Ireland; Shrewsbury Town 297 games) and manager (Dundalk, Derry City), born in Londonderry, Northern Ireland (d. 2024)

Dick Parry, English session and touring rock saxophonist (Pink Floyd - "Money"), born in Kentford, Suffolk

Paul Wolfowitz, American political scientist and diplomat, born in Brooklyn, New York

(Michael) "Mo" Foster, British session and touring rock bassist and producer, born in Byfleet, Surrey, England

Steve Carlton

American Baseball HOF pitcher (NL Cy Young Award 1972, 77, 80, 82; Triple Crown 1972; 10 x MLB All Star; St. Louis Cardinals, Philadelphia Phillies), born in Miami, Florida

Diane Sawyer, American newscaster (60 Minutes, ABC Prime Time), born in Glasgow, Kentucky

1945 Joris J. C. Voorhoeve, Dutch Defense minister (1994-, VVD), born in the Hague, Netherlands

1945 Marianne van Wijnkoop [Bosscher], Dutch actress (Les Miserables), born in Amsterdam, Netherlands

Brian C. Daley, American sci-fi author (Exploits of Han Solo, Tron), born in Englewood, New Jersey

Chris Old, English cricketer (England medium-pacer of 70's), born in Middlesborough, United Kingdom

Steve Garvey

American baseball player (LA Dodgers, San Diego Padres), born in Tampa, Florida

English rock-pop-disco singer-songwriter and bassist (Bee Gees - Saturday Night Fever), born in Douglas, Isle of Man

1949 Ray Guy, American College-Pro Football HOF punter (Southern Miss; Super Bowl 1976, 80, 84; 6 × First-team All-Pro; 7 × Pro Bowl; Oakland/LA Raiders), born in Swainsboro, Georgia (d. 2022)

Robin Gibb

English rock-pop-disco singer-songwriter and producer (Bee Gees - Saturday Night Fever), born in Douglas, Isle of Man

Charles de Lint, Canadian sci-fi author (Moonhear, Mulengro, Yarrow), born in Bussum, Netherlands

1951 Gerald Cavendish Grosvenor, 6th Duke of Westminster, British peer and its 3rd richest person, born in Omagh, Northern Ireland (d. 2016)

1951 Jan Stephenson, Australian golfer (3-time LPGA major winner; US Open 1983), born in Sydney, New South Wales

Bernnadette Stanis, American actress (Thelma-Good Times), born in Brooklyn, New York

1954 Hideshi Matsuda, Japanese racing driver, born in Kōchi Prefecture, Japan

1954 Jayaseelan Naidoo, South African worker's union leader, born in Durban, South Africa

Lonnie Smith, American MLB baseball outfielder, 1978-94; (Philadelphia Phillies, St. Louis Cardinals, Atlanta Braves, and 3 other teams), WS wins with 3 different teams, born in Chicago, Illinois

Carole James, Canadian politician, born in Dukinfield, United Kingdom

David Heavener, American actor and country musician, born in Louisville, Kentucky

1958 Lenny Von Dohlen, American actor (Love Kills, Electric Dreams), born in Augusta, Georgia

1960 Luther Campbell, American rap artist (2 Live Crew), born in Miami, Florida

1960 Patrick Fitzgerald, American lawyer, born in New York City

1960 Tyrell Biggs, American super HW boxer (Olympic gold 1984), born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Brian McMillan, South African cricket all-rounder (38 Tests, top score 113, 75 wickets; 78 ODIs), born in Welkom, South Africa

Mike Jackson, US pitcher (Seattle Mariners), born in Houston, Texas

Dmitry Bilozerchev, Soviet/Russian gymnast, born in Moscow, Russia
